intro: Rhexia bucardia, commonly known as the pinkroot, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to magenta flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy underside. Rhexia bucardia is also notable for its underground tubers, which give it the common name "pinkroot."
